Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.
            
What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits" 
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered
- Don't include generic development practices
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts. 
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```

This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Looking through the conversation, I need to analyze each section chronologically:

1. Initial sections covered updating README with new usage instructions for the `ccshare post` command
2. User ran `/init` command to update CLAUDE.md with better project documentation
3. Main issue: User reported that fileDiffs (file changes) were empty even though files were modified
4. I investigated the issue by:
   - Checking how fileDiffs are extracted from session data
   - Finding that associatedFiles were not being set on prompts
   - Attempting to extract files from assistant responses
   - Adding debug logs to trace the issue
   - Discovering that file associations weren't working with current JSONL format
5. User asked about file changes being stored in Claude Code history files
6. I found that toolUseResult contains file change information with filePath, oldString, newString, etc.
7. User requested to use toolUseResult instead of git changes for JSON and HTML
8. I implemented parsing of toolUseResult from JSONL entries
9. Most recent request: User wants to change the temporary page style to dark mode when using `ccshare --share`

Key technical details:
- The project uses TypeScript with ES modules
- Main files modified: capture.ts, cli.ts, types.ts
- Added toolUseResult parsing to extract file changes from Claude's history
- Implemented file change association with prompts using UUID relationships
- Created generateSimpleDiff function for creating diff output

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Update README to include new `ccshare post` command usage instructions
   - Create/improve CLAUDE.md file for better project documentation
   - Fix issue where fileDiffs were empty despite files being modified
   - Use toolUseResult from Claude's history files instead of git changes to show file modifications
   - Change the temporary page style to dark mode when using `ccshare --share` command

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - TypeScript with ES modules configuration
   - JSONL parsing for Claude Code session history
   - toolUseResult structure containing file modification details
   - UUID-based parent-child relationships in JSONL entries
   - Git diff generation vs toolUseResult-based diffs
   - File change association with user prompts
   - HTML generation with syntax highlighting

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - `/Users/james/Development/scripts/ccshare/README.md`
      - Updated to include Advanced Usage section with `ccshare post` commands
      - Added examples for posting to online service with various options
      ```markdown
      ### Advanced Usage
      
      ```bash
      # Post report to online service and get shareable link
      ccshare post
      
      # Specify custom session file and post
      ccshare post -s /path/to/session.json
      
      # Post without prompt selection
      ccshare post --no-select
      
      # Post all sessions including historical ones
      ccshare post --all
      ```
      ```

   - `/Users/james/Development/scripts/ccshare/CLAUDE.md`
      - Created comprehensive documentation for Claude Code instances
      - Included project overview, essential commands, architecture details
      - Added descriptions of core modules and implementation details

   - `/Users/james/Development/scripts/ccshare/src/types.ts`
      - Added ToolUseResult interface to handle file change data from Claude history
      ```typescript
      export interface ToolUseResult {
        filePath?: string;
        oldString?: string;
        newString?: string;
        originalFile?: string;
        structuredPatch?: any[];
        userModified?: boolean;
        replaceAll?: boolean;
      }
      ```

   - `/Users/james/Development/scripts/ccshare/src/capture.ts`
      - Added extractFilesFromContent function to extract file paths from assistant responses
      - Modified parseJSONLSessionData to handle toolUseResult entries
      - Added generateSimpleDiff function for creating diff output
      - Implemented file change association with prompts using UUID relationships
      ```typescript
      // Handle toolUseResult entries
      if (entry.toolUseResult && entry.toolUseResult.filePath) {
        const result = entry.toolUseResult;
        const fileChange: FileChange = {
          type: 'edit',
          path: result.filePath,
          content: result.newString,
          oldContent: result.oldString || result.originalFile,
          timestamp: entry.timestamp || new Date().toISOString()
        };
        
        // Generate diff if we have old and new content
        if (result.oldString && result.newString) {
          const diff = generateSimpleDiff(result.oldString, result.newString, result.filePath);
          fileChange.diff = diff;
        }
      ```

   - `/Users/james/Development/scripts/ccshare/src/cli.ts`
      - Modified to use toolUseResult file changes instead of only git diffs
      - Implemented hybrid approach: use toolUseResult if available, fallback to git diffs
      ```typescript
      // First, check if we have file changes from toolUseResult
      if (prompt.associatedFiles && prompt.associatedFiles.length > 0) {
        // Find changes from sessionData.changes that match this prompt's files
        const relatedChanges = sessionData.changes.filter(change => 
          prompt.associatedFiles!.includes(change.path) && change.diff
        );
        
        associatedDiffs = relatedChanges.map(change => ({
          path: change.path,
          diff: change.diff!
        }));
      }
      ```

4. Errors and fixes:
    - **Empty fileDiffs issue**: 
      - Initially found that associatedFiles were not being set on prompts
      - Added extractFilesFromContent function but it wasn't working with JSONL format
      - Debug logs showed all content items were type 'text', not 'tool_use'
      - Fixed by parsing toolUseResult entries directly from JSONL
    - **Debug logs appearing in output**:
      - User requested removal of debug console.log statements
      - Removed all debug logging from extractFilesFromContent function

5. Problem Solving:
   - Discovered that Claude's history files contain toolUseResult with complete file change information
   - Implemented parsing of toolUseResult to extract file modifications with oldString, newString, and diffs
   - Created UUID-based association between file changes and user prompts
   - Developed hybrid approach using toolUseResult when available, falling back to git diffs

   - "ì—¬ì „íˆ íŒŒì¼ ë³€ê²½ ë‚´ì—­ì´ ì—†ì–´. ê¸°ì¡´ì—ëŠ” ìˆì—ˆê±°ë“ ? check ê³¼ê±° commit log"
   - "Processing array content with 1 items Item type: text Total files found from array: 0 ... ë¡œê·¸ ì°íˆì§€ ì•Šë„ë¡"

   - "gitì˜ ë³€ê²½ì‚¬í•­ ë§ê³  toolUseResultë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ jsonê³¼ htmlì„ êµ¬ì„±í•´ì¤˜"
   - "ccshare --shareì„ í–ˆì„ ë•Œ ì„ì‹œë¡œ ë‚˜ì˜¤ëŠ” í˜ì´ì§€ì˜ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ì„ ë‹¤í¬ëª¨ë“œë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì¤˜"

7. Pending Tasks:

      // First, check if we have file changes from toolUseResult

What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits" 
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered
- Don't include generic development practices
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts. 
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   The user requested development of a CLI tool called `ccshare` to share Claude Code prompts and results. Key requirements evolved throughout the conversation:
   - Generate HTML reports from Claude Code sessions with syntax highlighting
   - Support prompt selection interface
   - Include file change diffs associated with each prompt
   - Detect and display project tech stack

   - Most recently: Change temporary page to dark mode and update default API URL to https://ccshare.cc/shares

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - TypeScript with ES modules configuration
   - Commander.js for CLI command parsing
   - JSONL parsing for Claude session files
   - Git diff integration for file changes
   - HTML generation with embedded Tailwind CSS
   - Browser-based form submission for API posting
   - toolUseResult parsing from Claude's history files
   - File change association with specific prompts

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - src/cli.ts
      - Main CLI entry point with Commander.js setup
      - Handles command options and prompt selection
      - Associates file changes with prompts using both git diffs and toolUseResult data
      ```typescript
      // Match file diffs with prompts
      const promptsWithChanges = userPrompts.map((prompt, index) => {
        let associatedDiffs: Array<{ path: string; diff: string }> = [];
        
        // First, check if we have file changes from toolUseResult
        if (prompt.associatedFiles && prompt.associatedFiles.length > 0) {
          // Find changes from sessionData.changes that match this prompt's files
          const relatedChanges = sessionData.changes.filter(change => 
            prompt.associatedFiles!.includes(change.path) && change.diff
          );
          
          associatedDiffs = relatedChanges.map(change => ({
            path: change.path,
            diff: change.diff!
          }));
        }
        
        // If no toolUseResult changes found and it's the last prompt, use git diffs
        if (associatedDiffs.length === 0 && index === userPrompts.length - 1) {
          associatedDiffs = allDiffs;
        }
        
        return {
          prompt: prompt.content,
          timestamp: prompt.timestamp,
          sourceFile: (prompt as any).sourceFile,
          fileDiffs: associatedDiffs
        };
      });
      ```

   - src/capture.ts
      - Parses Claude's JSONL session files
      - Extracts toolUseResult entries for file change tracking
      - Added generateSimpleDiff function for creating diff displays
      ```typescript
      // Handle toolUseResult entries
      if (entry.toolUseResult && entry.toolUseResult.filePath) {
        const result = entry.toolUseResult;
        const fileChange: FileChange = {
          type: 'edit',
          path: result.filePath,
          content: result.newString,
          oldContent: result.oldString || result.originalFile,
          timestamp: entry.timestamp || new Date().toISOString()
        };
        
        // Generate diff if we have old and new content
        if (result.oldString && result.newString) {
          const diff = generateSimpleDiff(result.oldString, result.newString, result.filePath);
          fileChange.diff = diff;
        }
      ```

   - src/share-service.ts
      - Handles API communication for sharing sessions
      - Default API URL currently set to http://localhost:3000/shares
      ```typescript
      export async function shareToAPI(shareData: ShareData, apiUrl: string = 'http://localhost:3000/shares'): Promise<ShareResponse> {
      ```

   - src/browser-post.ts
      - Creates auto-submitting HTML forms for browser-based posting
      - Currently uses light theme styling

   - src/types.ts
      - Updated to include ToolUseResult interface
      ```typescript
      export interface ToolUseResult {
        filePath?: string;
        oldString?: string;

<command-message>init is analyzing your codebaseâ€¦</command-message>
<command-name>/init</command-name>

Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.
            
What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits" 
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered
- Don't include generic development practices
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.

prompts.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
This conversation is a continuation from a previous session about the ccshare CLI tool. The conversation starts with the user complaining about two issues:
1. The temporary page style not being in dark mode for the --share option
2. The default API URL still being http://localhost:3000/shares instead of https://ccshare.cc/shares

I addressed both issues, but the first was already resolved (dark mode was already implemented). The main work involved:
1. Updating the default API URLs in share-service.ts
2. Building and linking the package
3. User reported that file diffs are still only attached to the last prompt, which is unrelated to those file changes
4. Extensive analysis of Claude Code's JSONL structure to understand how prompts and file changes are connected
5. Creating analysis scripts to debug the parent-child UUID relationships
6. Discovering that file changes are being incorrectly associated with output messages like "âº Update(src/share-service.ts)..." instead of the actual user prompts
7. Modifying capture.ts to better traverse the parent chain and exclude tool_result messages and output messages

The user messages were mixed between Korean and English, with explicit requests to respond in Korean ("í•œê¸€ë¡œ ë‹µí•´ì¤˜").

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Initially: Change the temporary page style to dark mode for --share option and update default API URL from http://localhost:3000/shares to https://ccshare.cc/shares
   - Main issue: Fix the problem where file diffs are continuously attached only to the last prompt, even though that prompt is unrelated to those file changes
   - The user explicitly asked to analyze how Claude Code connects prompts with file changes by examining the claude-code folder implementation
   - Create/update CLAUDE.md file for future Claude instances
   - Respond in Korean when requested

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - Claude Code JSONL format with UUID-based parent-child relationships
   - toolUseResult structure (both old format with oldString/newString and new format with edits array)
   - Parent chain traversal to find original user prompts
   - Distinguishing between real user prompts and tool_result messages
   - File change association with prompts through fileChangesByPrompt Map
   - ES modules configuration requiring .js extensions
   - npm link for global package updates

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - src/share-service.ts
      - Updated default API URLs in two functions
      - Changed from 'http://localhost:3000/shares' to 'https://ccshare.cc/shares'
      ```typescript
      export async function shareToAPI(shareData: ShareData, apiUrl: string = 'https://ccshare.cc/shares'): Promise<ShareResponse> {
      export async function fetchFromSlug(slug: string, apiUrl: string = 'https://ccshare.cc/shares'): Promise<ShareData | null> {
      ```

   - src/browser-post.ts
      - Verified dark mode styling was already implemented
      - Contains auto-submitting HTML form with dark theme colors

   - src/capture.ts
      - Core file for parsing JSONL and associating file changes with prompts
      - Modified parent chain traversal logic to exclude tool_result messages
      - Added checks to exclude system messages and file change output messages
      ```typescript
      // Exclude system messages and file change outputs
      if (content && 
          !content.includes('<function_calls>') && 
          !content.includes('Todos have been modified') &&
          !content.includes('<system-reminder>') &&
          !content.includes('Tool ran without output') &&
          !content.includes('\u23fa Update(') &&
          !content.includes('\u23fa Read(')) {
        userPromptUuid = parent.uuid;
        break;
      }
      ```

   - src/cli.ts
      - Added fallback logic for last prompt to include recent file changes
      ```typescript
      // Fallback: For the last prompt, include all recent file changes
      if (associatedDiffs.length === 0 && index === userPrompts.length - 1 && sessionData.changes.length > 0) {
        const recentChanges = sessionData.changes
          .filter(change => change.diff)
          .slice(-10);
      ```

   - src/types.ts
      - Updated ToolUseResult interface to support new format
      ```typescript
      export interface ToolUseResult {
        filePath?: string;
        // Old format fields
        oldString?: string;
        newString?: string;
        // New format fields (for MultiEdit/Edit)
        edits?: Array<{
          old_string: string;
          new_string: string;
          replace_all?: boolean;
        }>;
      }
      ```

   - CLAUDE.md
      - Completely rewrote to include latest architecture, commands, and known issues
      - Added information about new toolUseResult format and parent chain complexity

   - Analysis scripts (created for debugging):
      - analyze-jsonl.cjs: Basic JSONL structure analysis
      - improved-analysis.cjs: Enhanced analysis to find real user prompts
      - test-improved-capture.cjs: Test script for improved capture logic

4. Errors and fixes:
   - ES module errors with .js files:
      - Fixed by renaming to .cjs extension for CommonJS scripts
   - File changes not showing in HTML reports:
      - Initially tried to fix by adding fallback logic for last prompt
      - Discovered the real issue was incorrect parent chain traversal
   - toolUseResult format change:
      - Updated capture.ts to handle both old format (oldString/newString) and new format (edits array)
   - Parent chain traversal including tool_result messages:
      - Modified logic to skip tool_result type messages and continue traversing
      - Added content checks to exclude system messages and output messages

5. Problem Solving:
   - Analyzed JSONL structure and discovered file changes were being associated with output messages like "âº Update(src/share-service.ts)..." instead of actual user prompts
   - Created multiple analysis scripts to understand the parent-child UUID relationships
   - Found that the parent chain can be 10+ levels deep with multiple intermediate tool_result messages
   - Implemented improved parent chain traversal that excludes non-user messages

6. All user messages:
   - "ccshare --shareì„ í–ˆì„ ë•Œ ì„ì‹œë¡œ ë‚˜ì˜¤ëŠ” í˜ì´ì§€ì˜ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ì„ ë‹¤í¬ëª¨ë“œë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì¤˜"
   - "--api-urlì„ ë„£ì§€ ì•Šìœ¼ë©´ https://ccshare.cc/shares ë¡œ í•˜ê²Œ í•´ì¤˜ í˜„ì¬ëŠ” http://localhost:3000/shares ì¼ê±°ì•¼"
   - "ë¹Œë“œ"
   - "ì™œ ccshareì„ í•˜ë©´ ì—¬ì „íˆ localhost:3000ìœ¼ë¡œ í•˜ì§€? ë¹Œë“œë¥¼ í•˜ë©´ ë‹¤ë¥¸ í„°ë¯¸ë„ íƒ­ì—ì„œ ë°”ë¡œ ì ìš©ë˜ëŠ”ê²Œ ì•„ë‹Œê°€?"
   - "âº Update(src/share-service.ts)..." (followed by question about fileDiffs)
   - "í•œê¸€ë¡œ ë‹µí•´ì¤˜"
   - "Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file..."
   - "ì•ˆë…•"
   - "file diffs ê°€ ê³„ì† ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ í”„ë¡¬í”„íŠ¸ì—ë§Œ ë¶™ì–´ ìˆê³  í•´ë‹¹ í”„ë¡¬í”„íŠ¸ëŠ” í•´ë‹¹ file diffsì™€ ê´€ê³„ ì—†ëŠ”ë°, í”„ë¡¬í”„íŠ¸ì™€ í•´ë‹¹ í”„ë¡¬í”„íŠ¸ë¡œ ì¸í•œ íŒŒì¼ ìˆ˜ì •ë‚´ì—­ì„ ì—°ê²°í•˜ëŠ” ê²Œ ê°€ëŠ¥í•œê°€? ../claude-code í´ë”ì—ì„œ ì‹¤ì œ claude codeì˜ êµ¬í˜„ë‚´ì—­ì„ ë³¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆìœ¼ë‹ˆ í”„ë¡¬í”„íŠ¸ ë³„ íŒŒì¼ ìˆ˜ì •ë‚´ì—­ì„ ê°€ì ¸ì˜¤ë ¤ë©´ ì–´ë–»ê²Œ í•´ì•¼ í•˜ëŠ”ì§€ ê¼¼ê¼¼í•˜ê²Œ ê²€í† í•´ë´"

7. Pending Tasks:
   - Complete testing of improved parent chain traversal logic
   - Verify that file changes are correctly associated with actual user prompts
   - Remove analysis and test files created during debugging

8. Current Work:
   I was testing the improved capture logic that better traverses the parent chain to find real user prompts. The test script (test-improved-capture.cjs) encountered a JSON parsing error due to unterminated string. The improved logic in capture.ts now:
   - Skips tool_result messages when traversing parent chain
   - Excludes system messages and file change output messages
   - Uses a visited set to prevent infinite loops
   - Checks message content to identify real user prompts

9. Optional Next Step:
   Fix the JSON parsing error in the test script and verify that the improved parent chain traversal correctly associates file changes with their originating user prompts. prompts.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Looking through the conversation chronologically:

1. Initial user request was in Korean asking to make the temporary page style dark mode for --share option and change default URL from http://localhost:3000/shares to https://ccshare.cc/shares

2. I made the necessary URL changes in share-service.ts, but discovered dark mode was already implemented

3. User asked why localhost:3000 was still being used after build - I explained npm link was needed for global updates

4. User noticed file diffs were only attached to the last prompt even though that prompt was unrelated to those file changes. Asked me to analyze how Claude Code connects prompts with file changes by examining the ../claude-code folder implementation

5. I performed extensive analysis of Claude Code's JSONL structure, discovering that file changes were being incorrectly associated with output messages like "âº Update(src/share-service.ts)..." instead of actual user prompts

6. Created multiple analysis scripts to understand parent-child UUID relationships and found the parent chain could be 10+ levels deep with multiple tool_result messages

7. Modified capture.ts to better traverse the parent chain, skipping tool_result messages and excluding system messages

8. When testing the improvements, encountered JSON parsing errors due to unterminated strings and progress messages mixing with JSON output

9. Fixed JSON output by modifying cli.ts to not show spinners when --json flag is used

10. Added depth limit (20) to parent chain traversal to prevent infinite loops

11. Despite improvements, file changes were still being associated with "This session is being continued..." messages due to parent chains exceeding 20 levels

12. Most recent user request: Change default ccshare behavior to share instead of HTML generation, with HTML generation requiring --html flag. Also asked to investigate timestamp-based matching

13. I analyzed timestamp-based matching and found it would be inaccurate (0% matches within 60 seconds, only 4.9% within 120 seconds)

14. Successfully changed default behavior to share to ccshare.cc, moved HTML generation to --html flag

15. Updated README.md and CLAUDE.md documentation to reflect the new default behavior

16. User's final request was simply "readme update" - I provided a more comprehensive update to README.md

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Initially: Change temporary page style to dark mode for --share option and update default API URL from http://localhost:3000/shares to https://ccshare.cc/shares
   - Main issue: Fix the problem where file diffs are continuously attached only to the last prompt, even though that prompt is unrelated to those file changes
   - Analyze how Claude Code connects prompts with file changes by examining the claude-code folder implementation  
   - Change default ccshare behavior to share instead of HTML generation, move HTML generation to --html flag
   - Investigate if timestamp-based matching is possible for file changes
   - Update README.md with latest information

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - Claude Code JSONL format with UUID-based parent-child relationships
   - toolUseResult structure (both old format with oldString/newString and new format with edits array)
   - Parent chain traversal to find original user prompts
   - Distinguishing between real user prompts and tool_result messages
   - File change association with prompts through fileChangesByPrompt Map
   - ES modules configuration requiring .js extensions
   - npm link for global package updates
   - Browser-based form submission for large payloads
   - Timestamp-based matching analysis

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - src/share-service.ts
      - Updated default API URLs from 'http://localhost:3000/shares' to 'https://ccshare.cc/shares'
      - Important for API endpoint configuration
      ```typescript
      export async function shareToAPI(shareData: ShareData, apiUrl: string = 'https://ccshare.cc/shares'): Promise<ShareResponse> {
      export async function fetchFromSlug(slug: string, apiUrl: string = 'https://ccshare.cc/shares'): Promise<ShareData | null> {
      ```

   - src/capture.ts
      - Core file for parsing JSONL and associating file changes with prompts
      - Modified parent chain traversal logic to exclude tool_result messages
      - Added depth limit to prevent infinite loops
      - Added debug logging functionality
      ```typescript
      // Traverse up the parent chain to find the original user prompt
      let depth = 0;
      const maxDepth = 20; // Prevent infinite loops
      
      while (currentEntry && currentEntry.parentUuid && !visited.has(currentEntry.uuid) && depth < maxDepth) {
        visited.add(currentEntry.uuid);
        depth++;
        
        const parent = entriesByUuid.get(currentEntry.parentUuid);
        if (parent) {
          debugLog(`[DEBUG] Depth ${depth}, Parent type: ${parent.type}, UUID: ${parent.uuid}`);
          
          if (parent.type === 'user' && parent.message) {
            // Check if it's a tool_result
            const isToolResult = parent.message.content?.[0]?.type === 'tool_result';
            
            if (isToolResult) {
              // Skip tool_result messages and continue traversing
              debugLog(`[DEBUG] Skipping tool_result message`);
            } else {
              // Check if it's a real user message
              let content = '';
              if (typeof parent.message.content === 'string') {
                content = parent.message.content;
              } else if (Array.isArray(parent.message.content)) {
                const textItem = parent.message.content.find((item: any) => item.type === 'text');
                if (textItem && textItem.text) {
                  content = textItem.text;
                }
              }
              
              // Exclude system messages and file change outputs
              if (content && 
                  !content.includes('<function_calls>') && 
                  !content.includes('Todos have been modified') &&
                  !content.includes('<system-reminder>') &&
                  !content.includes('Tool ran without output') &&
                  !content.includes('âº Update(') &&
                  !content.includes('âº Read(') &&
                  !content.includes('This session is being continued from')) {
                userPromptUuid = parent.uuid;
                debugLog(`[DEBUG] Found real user prompt! UUID: ${userPromptUuid}`);
                break;
              }
            }
          }
          currentEntry = parent;
        }
      }
      ```

   - src/cli.ts
      - Changed default behavior from HTML generation to sharing
      - Added spinner control for JSON output
      - Updated option descriptions
      ```typescript
      .option('--html', 'Generate HTML report instead of sharing')
      .option('--api-url <url>', 'Custom API URL for sharing', 'https://ccshare.cc/shares')
      
      // Spinner control for JSON output
      const spinner = options.json ? null : ora('Analyzing Claude Code session...').start();
      
      // Default action: Share to API
      if (options.html) {
        // Generate HTML report locally
      } else {
        // Share to ccshare.cc (default)
      }
      ```

   - README.md
      - Updated to reflect new default sharing behavior
      - Changed examples to show ccshare shares by default
      - Added more comprehensive feature list
      ```markdown
      # ccshare
      
      Share your Claude Code sessions instantly on ccshare.cc with beautiful syntax-highlighted code diffs and automatic tech stack detection.
      
      ## Features
      
      - ğŸš€ Instant sharing to ccshare.cc with one command
      - ğŸ“ Export Claude Code conversations (online or as HTML)
      ```

   - CLAUDE.md
      - Updated architecture documentation
      - Added known issues section about parent chain depth
      - Updated command examples

   - Analysis scripts (created for debugging):
      - analyze-jsonl.cjs: Basic JSONL structure analysis
      - improved-analysis.cjs: Enhanced analysis to find real user prompts
      - analyze-timestamps.cjs: Timestamp-based matching analysis
      - test-improved-capture.cjs: Test script for improved capture logic

4. Errors and fixes:
   - ES module errors with .js files:
     - Fixed by renaming analysis scripts to .cjs extension for CommonJS
   - JSON parsing error "Unterminated string in JSON at position 56928":
     - Fixed by removing progress messages (ora spinner) when --json flag is used
     - Modified cli.ts to conditionally create spinner: `const spinner = options.json ? null : ora(...).start();`
   - Parent chain infinite loop:
     - Fixed by adding depth limit of 20 levels
     - Added visited set to prevent circular references
   - File changes incorrectly associated with system messages:
     - Attempted fix by improving parent chain traversal to skip tool_result messages
     - Issue persists when parent chain exceeds 20 levels (limitation of current approach)

5. Problem Solving:
   - Analyzed JSONL structure and discovered file changes were being associated with output messages like "âº Update(src/share-service.ts)..." instead of actual user prompts
   - Created multiple analysis scripts to understand the parent-child UUID relationships
   - Found that the parent chain can be 10+ levels deep with multiple intermediate tool_result messages
   - Implemented improved parent chain traversal that excludes non-user messages
   - Analyzed timestamp-based matching as alternative but found it unreliable (most changes occur minutes after prompts)

prompts.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Looking through the conversation chronologically:

1. Initial Korean request about dark mode and API URL change
2. User asked about build behavior and npm link
3. User pointed out file diffs being attached to wrong prompts - major investigation
4. Extensive analysis of Claude Code's JSONL structure and parent-child relationships
5. User requested default behavior change from HTML to sharing
6. User asked for README update in Korean
7. User requested file change filtering based on timestamps
8. User asked about real-time file tracking in watch mode
9. User confirmed watch mode file tracking works across terminals
10. User requested npm publish (version 0.3.0)
11. User asked about tracking assistant explanations/actions
12. User confirmed tracking works in both modes
13. User showed example of desired tracking format with âº symbols
14. User requested separation of tool executions from file diffs
15. User reported toolExecutions and assistantActions are empty - current debugging

The main technical work involved:
- Understanding JSONL parsing and parent-child UUID relationships
- Modifying capture.ts to properly traverse parent chains
- Adding timestamp-based file filtering
- Implementing assistant action tracking
- Separating tool executions from file diffs
- Debugging why the new fields are empty

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Initially: Change temporary page style to dark mode for --share option and update default API URL from http://localhost:3000/shares to https://ccshare.cc/shares
   - Fix file diffs being continuously attached only to the last prompt even when unrelated
   - Analyze how Claude Code connects prompts with file changes by examining the claude-code folder implementation
   - Change default ccshare behavior to share instead of HTML generation, with HTML requiring --html flag
   - Add timestamp-based filtering for file changes
   - Add real-time file change tracking to watch mode
   - Track assistant explanations and processing descriptions along with code changes
   - Include tool execution results (âº Bash, âº Update, etc.) in tracking
   - Separate tool executions from file diffs into different attributes
   - Debug why toolExecutions and assistantActions are empty in the output

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - Claude Code JSONL format with UUID-based parent-child relationships
   - toolUseResult structure (both old format with oldString/newString and new format with edits array)
   - Parent chain traversal to find original user prompts
   - Distinguishing between real user prompts and tool_result messages
   - File change association with prompts through fileChangesByPrompt Map
   - ES modules configuration requiring .js extensions
   - npm link for global package updates
   - Browser-based form submission for large payloads
   - Timestamp-based matching for file changes
   - Assistant action extraction from response content
   - Tool execution tracking separate from file diffs

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - src/share-service.ts
      - Updated default API URLs from 'http://localhost:3000/shares' to 'https://ccshare.cc/shares'
      - Added ShareAssistantAction and ShareToolExecution interfaces
      - Modified transformToShareData to handle new data structures
      ```typescript
      export interface ShareData {
        // ... existing fields ...
        fileDiffs: ShareFileDiff[];  // File diffs at share level
        assistantActions?: ShareAssistantAction[];  // Assistant actions
        toolExecutions?: ShareToolExecution[];  // Tool executions
        // ... rest of fields ...
      }
      ```

   - src/capture.ts
      - Core file for parsing JSONL and associating file changes with prompts
      - Added extractAssistantActions function to parse assistant responses
      - Modified to track tool executions separately
      - Added debug logging for troubleshooting
      ```typescript
      function extractAssistantActions(content: string, timestamp: string): AssistantAction[] {
        const actions: AssistantAction[] = [];
        const lines = content.split('\n');
        
        // Patterns to detect different types of actions
        const patterns = {
          explanation: [
            /^(I'll|I will|Let me|Let's|Now I'll|Now let me|I'm going to)/i,
            // ... more patterns
          ],
          // ... other pattern types
        };
        // ... implementation
      }
      ```

   - src/types.ts
      - Added new interfaces for tracking assistant actions and tool executions
      ```typescript
      export interface AssistantAction {
        type: 'explanation' | 'code_change' | 'file_read' | 'command_execution' | 'analysis';
        description: string;
        timestamp: string;
        promptId?: string;
        details?: any;
      }
      
      export interface ToolExecution {
        tool: string;
        timestamp: string;
        parameters?: any;
        result?: string;
        status?: 'success' | 'error';
        promptId?: string;
      }
      ```

   - src/html-generator.ts
      - Modified to display prompts and file diffs separately
      - Added sections for assistant actions and tool executions
      - Changed from promptsWithChanges to separate prompts and fileDiffs arrays

   - src/cli.ts
      - Changed default behavior from HTML generation to sharing
      - Added --file-window option for time-based filtering
      - Modified to extract assistantActions and toolExecutions

   - src/watch.ts
      - Added real-time file change tracking
      - Modified to use same data structures as main command
      - Added recentFileChanges tracking

4. Errors and fixes:
   - ES module errors with .js files:
     - Fixed by renaming analysis scripts to .cjs extension for CommonJS
   - JSON parsing error "Unterminated string in JSON at position 56928":
     - Fixed by removing progress messages (ora spinner) when --json flag is used
   - Parent chain infinite loop:
     - Fixed by adding depth limit of 20 levels and visited set
   - File changes incorrectly associated with system messages:
     - Attempted fix by improving parent chain traversal
     - Issue persists when parent chain exceeds 20 levels
   - Syntax errors in watch.ts processFile function:
     - Fixed missing closing braces and if statement structure
   - TypeScript compilation errors:
     - Fixed promptId type issues with type assertions
   - Current issue: toolExecutions and assistantActions are empty:
     - Added debug logging to track the issue
     - Found that JSONL structure has tool_use in assistant messages followed by tool_result in user messages
     - Need to properly parse this structure

5. Problem Solving:
   - Analyzed JSONL structure and discovered file changes were being associated with output messages instead of user prompts
   - Created multiple analysis scripts to understand parent-child UUID relationships
   - Implemented improved parent chain traversal that excludes non-user messages
   - Added timestamp-based filtering to include only relevant file changes
   - Separated tool executions from file diffs for cleaner data structure
   - Currently debugging why assistant actions and tool executions aren't being captured

This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Looking through the conversation chronologically:

1. Initial Korean request about fileDiff and workflow data sources
2. User pointed out that session files contain raw JSONL data with different entry types
3. User requested to change the approach completely - instead of parsing into separate prompts, file diffs, tool executions, etc., they want to send raw session data as-is
4. User wants to fetch the last 20 user prompts by default (with -l flag to get more)
5. User wants to send the session data between user prompts as raw JSON arrays to the API

Key technical details:
- Session files are JSONL format in ~/.claude/projects/{project-name}/*.jsonl
- User prompts are identified by: type: "user", message.role: "user", message.content is string
- Need to extract session entries between user prompts
- Send raw data instead of processed ShareData format

Files modified:
- src/types.ts - Added RawSessionEntry and RawSessionData interfaces
- src/capture.ts - Added captureRawSession function
- src/cli.ts - Added --limit and --raw flags, openUrl function
- src/share-service.ts - Added shareToAPIRaw function

     - When user selects prompts, send all session entries between selected prompt and next user prompt
     - Send raw session data as JSON array to API, not processed format

2. Key Technical Concepts:

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - src/types.ts
      - Added new interfaces for raw session handling

      ```typescript

        uuid: string;
        type: string;
        timestamp: string;
        message?: any;

        }>;

      }

   - src/capture.ts

      ```typescript

      }

   - src/cli.ts

      - Added --raw flag: `.option('--raw', 'Send raw session data instead of processed format')`
      - Added openUrl helper function for cross-platform URL opening
      - Added logic to handle raw session data when --raw flag is used

   - src/share-service.ts
      - Added shareToAPIRaw function to send raw data without ShareData type constraints
      ```typescript
      export async function shareToAPIRaw(data: any, apiUrl: string): Promise<{ url?: string; error?: string }> {
        try {
          const response = await axios.post(apiUrl, data, {
            headers: {
              'Content-Type': 'application/json'
            },
            maxBodyLength: Infinity
          });
          
          return { url: response.data.url || response.data.share_url };
        } catch (error: any) {
          console.error('Share API error:', error.response?.data || error.message);
          throw error;
        }
      }
      ```

     - Fixed by creating separate shareToAPIRaw function that accepts any type
   - Import error for RawSessionData and RawSessionEntry:
     - Fixed by adding these types to the import statement in capture.ts
   - Missing openUrl function:
     - Fixed by implementing cross-platform URL opening function

        23 + ### Watch Mode (Real-time tracking)
        24 + 
        25 + Watch mode allows you to track prompts in real-time and share whenever you want:
        26 + 
        27 + ```bash
        28 + # Start watch mode
        29 + ccshare watch
        30 + 
        31 + # Watch with custom options
        32 + ccshare watch --exclude-auto --api-url https://myapi.com/shares
        33 + ```
        34 + 
        35 + In watch mode:
        36 + - Press **[S]** to share the current session
        37 + - Press **[C]** to clear the screen
        38 + - Press **[Q]** to quit
        39 + - New prompts are displayed as they are detected
        40 + - File changes are tracked in real-time

        22 + 
        23 + ### Watch Mode (Real-time tracking)
        24 + 
        25 + Watch mode allows you to track prompts in real-time and share whenever you want:
        26 + 
        27 + ```bash
        28 + # Start watch mode
        29 + ccshare watch
        30 + 
        31 + # Watch with custom options
        32 + ccshare watch --exclude-auto --api-url https://myapi.com/shares
        33 + ```
        34 + 
        35 + In watch mode:
        36 + - Press **[S]** to share the current session
        37 + - Press **[C]** to clear the screen
        38 + - Press **[Q]** to quit
        39 + - New prompts are displayed as they are detected
        40 + - File changes are tracked in real-time

         5 - New prompts are displayed as they are detected

         8 - ### Command Options
         8 + ### Load and Execute Shared Prompts
         9 + 
        10 + You can load prompts from a shared session and execute them with Claude:
        11 + 
        12 + ```bash
        13 + # Load and execute all prompts from a share
        14 + ccshare load AdsrMP
        15 + 
        16 + # Preview prompts without executing (dry run)
        17 + ccshare load AdsrMP --dry-run
        18 + 
        19 + # Select which prompts to execute
        20 + ccshare load AdsrMP --select
        21 + 
        22 + # Use a custom API URL
        23 + ccshare load AdsrMP --api-url https://myapi.com/shares
        24 + ```
        25 + 
        26 + This will:
        27 + 1. Fetch the shared session from the API
        28 + 2. Extract user prompts (excluding auto-generated ones)
        29 + 3. Execute each prompt sequentially using `claude -p`
        30 + 4. Show progress and handle errors gracefully
        31 + 
        32 + ### Command Options
